result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney Valentino Donnell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Total court costs paid in full out of bond

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodney Valentino Donnell

records.addlTxt: Surety withdrawn
Refund to surety of bond less actual costs.

9:04 AM Defendant Rodney Valentino Donnell in court.  Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court for Rodney Valentino Donnell.  Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Pretrial offer has been extended to defendant and it is accepted. Case to be recalled. 
9:32am Case recalled, same appearances. State files an Amended Information. Copy provided to counsel. Plea questionnaire filed. State gives recommendation. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty.
